intro: Lepidium utaviense, commonly known as the Utavi peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, erect stature and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lepidium utaviense is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
